definitions.definition: Prior to some specified time , either past, present, or future; by this time; previously .
examples: I was surprised that she hadn’t already told me the news.
Much of what he said I knew already .

definitions.definition: An intensifier used to emphasize impatience or express exasperation .
examples: I wish they'd finish already , so we can get going.

definitions.definition: Marks a change in state ( inchoative aspect ).

main_definition: Prior to some specified time , either past, present, or future; by this time; previously .
secondary_definitions: ( US , Canada ) An intensifier used to emphasize impatience or express exasperation .
( Singapore , Singlish ) Indicates action completion ( perfective aspect ).
( Singapore , Singlish ) Marks a change in state ( inchoative aspect ).
